a home in a wood in the mountains of

desperate to enter a tiny piece of
Europe which they can see down below any
ot has been living in the forest for

he travelled all the way from Cameroon
but now he's trapped an illegal
immigrant in Morocco hiding from the

in street I can't just walk in the

I'm a prisoner I don't have any liberty

an unwelcome community within touching

for the my immigrants the mountain of
goo Goo's Mountain is the hell and Melia
is Babylon for them but this is what
stands in their way on this side of the

a half kilometers around Malaya we're in
Spain Europe on the other side is

fences is 8 meters high but the migrants
have developed tactics and techniques
which have proved very effective in

scaled the fence filmed by the police
who call it a human avalanche Spain is
spending more on placing its border but

for those that cross there's little work
but there is somewhere to sleep Malia's

me they dream of life in Britain but the
authorities here plan to send most back
to the country where their journey began
Malia manages tens of thousands of
crossings from Morocco every day but
it's now calling on its European
partners for help
to stop those on the mountain who are
planning their illegal attempt to enter
Europe and Spain Tom barrage BBC news in
